Functions
xps_fnc_collection
Description

Creates and works with Collection which stores a complete item in a HashMap store (such as the [Items] key) with a subkey for quick lookup. This differs from a <Container> in that all values are easily retrievable at once. The drawback is that if you only need a single value, you have to do an additional lookup within the returned value set.

They are, however, structurally similar as simply a base HashMap. It is up to the implementation function to treat them as they are so labelled.

  • Note: a Collection might often store multiple <Containers> or vice-versa

Parameters
data

Array - array of parameters. See below for per operation parameters

operation

String - operation - Command operation.

collection

Collection - the Collection to perform the operation on

Returns

See below for operations

Examples
["_create",["MyNewCollection", [0,"",[],objNull], ["",0,0]] = call xps_fnc_collection;
Author

CrashDome

Operators
["create"]
Parameters

Data Array: [name, allowedTypes, arrayTemplate]

name

String - a descriptive name for the collection - the shorter the better

allowedTypes

Array - similar to the allowed types in a Params call.

arrayTemplate

Array - used to perform an isEqualTypeParams call on an item that is an Array

Returns
Collection

Multi-Dimensional HashMap or nothing(nil) if failed

Examples
["registerAllowedType"]
Parameters

Data Array: [type]

type

<Any> - similar to the allowed types in a Params call.  e.g use "" for String or [] for Array

Returns
True/False if succeeded

will return false if type already in list

Examples
["addItem"]
Parameters

Data Array: [key, item]

key

<Any> - the key used to store the item

item

<Any> - any data type - checks if allowed via AllowedTypes and ArrayTemplate

Returns

True/False if succeeded

Examples
["removeItem"]
Parameters

Data Array: [key]

key

<Any> - the key used to store the item

Returns

True/False if succeeded
